I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. We asked Sato about some of the challenges of playing a dead boy, his relationship with the source material, as well as his take on ghosts, ahead of the release of the TV show. I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. We asked Sato about some of the challenges of playing a dead boy, his relationship with the source material, as well as his take on ghosts, ahead of the release of the TV show. I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. PREVIEW: The Mecha Action-Shooter Gundam Evolution   by Jean-Karlo Lemus, Apr 14th 2022          The Gundam universe has no shortage of video game adaptations, and this past week saw the five-day-long network test for Bandai Namco's newest take on the storied franchise. Gundam Evolution stands poised to be the franchise's first-ever free-to-play shooter. We were allowed to take part in the network test for the Steam version of the game and experience it first-hand.     As the title implies, players operate as specific mobile suits from across the Gundam franchise. The selection of mech units is surprisingly eclectic: while the traditional RX-78-2 Mobile Suit is of course selectable, armed with its beam cannon and hammer, players can also control the Turn ∀  Gundam, the Gundam Exia, the Barbatos Gundam, and even non-Gundam units like the Guntank, the Zaku II, and the Dom. Each unit controls more or less the same, with the main differences being the nature of their weapons and their skills: while most units like the RX-78 focus on ranged weapons, some units like the Barbatos or the Exia focus on melee attacks. Being mechs, each unit has thrusters that allow for dashes, boosts, and hovering, adding lots of complexity to movement. Each unit also features two unique skills with cooldowns, and a chargeable G-maneuver that unleashes a special skill. During our playtime, we specialized in the Turn ∀ Gundam, which featured a charge shot for their beam canon, a personal healing skill, and a grappling attack. In all, there are 14 playable units.    Gundam Evolution's network test consisted of simple online ranked matches where teams of six compete against each other. Three gameplay modes will be featured in the full game: Point Capture, Domination, and Destruction. Each mode features teams alternating between Attackers and Defenders, tasked with either carrying out specific objectives or preventing the opposing team from carrying them out. Domination requires Attackers to capture one of three randomly-spawning objectives, Destruction requires charging a bomb at a point on the map until it detonates the point, and Point Capture involves simply occupying a point on the map in order to score points. During our time in the Network Test, we only experienced Point Capture. We also only tested out one map, but there was no shortage of excitement to be had. Further gameplay modes have been promised in the future following the full release of the title.     Matches are a good mix of hectic chaos and tense anticipation. A lack of awareness will get you destroyed in short order, thus a keen eye and quick reflexes are essential to survival. It's possible to rescue downed units before they're destroyed, albeit at the risk of leaving yourself open to attackers that are no doubt still in the area. Capture points quickly become heated clashes between teams as they're contested, the ebb and flow of the match varying as units are shot down or respawn to rejoin the fray. A well-balanced match can easily run into overtime as both teams struggle for a foothold above the other. The connections were stable, however we did experience a drop from the network during one particularly heated match. With Gundam Evolution still being tested and refined, we can hope that this problem will be smoothed over.    Gundam Evolution is free-to-play and features an in-game cash shop, as well as a battle pass, alternate skins, and player icons. Old Gundams can be customized with snazzy recolors, while players can set their profile pictures to images of beloved Gundam characters like Amuro Ray or Char Aznable. Skins can also be earned by leveling up with your battle pass; the network test featured an exclusive skin for the RX-78 attainable upon reaching level 20. For the most part, skins seem to be available through a lootbox system, which players buy into via tickets earned from the cash shop or from in-game awards.     In all, Gundam Evolution's network test was a success. While some network issues interrupted the fun and the looming threat of a lootbox system shadows the game, the moment-to-moment gameplay is fun and frantic and the sheer fanservice of zipping through the map as the White Devil, complete with classic Gundam sound effects, is undeniably charming. While a definite release date has yet to be set, players can look forward to Gundam Evolution's release later this year on PS4, Xbox One, PS5, Xbox Series S and X, and Steam.     discuss this in the forum (5 posts) |        bookmark/share with:               Feature homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            interview                I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato   Apr 18, 21:00                 live-action    This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. PREVIEW: The Mecha Action-Shooter Gundam Evolution   by Jean-Karlo Lemus, Apr 14th 2022          The Gundam universe has no shortage of video game adaptations, and this past week saw the five-day-long network test for Bandai Namco's newest take on the storied franchise. Gundam Evolution stands poised to be the franchise's first-ever free-to-play shooter. We were allowed to take part in the network test for the Steam version of the game and experience it first-hand.     As the title implies, players operate as specific mobile suits from across the Gundam franchise. The selection of mech units is surprisingly eclectic: while the traditional RX-78-2 Mobile Suit is of course selectable, armed with its beam cannon and hammer, players can also control the Turn ∀  Gundam, the Gundam Exia, the Barbatos Gundam, and even non-Gundam units like the Guntank, the Zaku II, and the Dom. Each unit controls more or less the same, with the main differences being the nature of their weapons and their skills: while most units like the RX-78 focus on ranged weapons, some units like the Barbatos or the Exia focus on melee attacks. Being mechs, each unit has thrusters that allow for dashes, boosts, and hovering, adding lots of complexity to movement. Each unit also features two unique skills with cooldowns, and a chargeable G-maneuver that unleashes a special skill. During our playtime, we specialized in the Turn ∀ Gundam, which featured a charge shot for their beam canon, a personal healing skill, and a grappling attack. In all, there are 14 playable units.    Gundam Evolution's network test consisted of simple online ranked matches where teams of six compete against each other. Three gameplay modes will be featured in the full game: Point Capture, Domination, and Destruction. Each mode features teams alternating between Attackers and Defenders, tasked with either carrying out specific objectives or preventing the opposing team from carrying them out. Domination requires Attackers to capture one of three randomly-spawning objectives, Destruction requires charging a bomb at a point on the map until it detonates the point, and Point Capture involves simply occupying a point on the map in order to score points. During our time in the Network Test, we only experienced Point Capture. We also only tested out one map, but there was no shortage of excitement to be had. Further gameplay modes have been promised in the future following the full release of the title.     Matches are a good mix of hectic chaos and tense anticipation. A lack of awareness will get you destroyed in short order, thus a keen eye and quick reflexes are essential to survival. It's possible to rescue downed units before they're destroyed, albeit at the risk of leaving yourself open to attackers that are no doubt still in the area. Capture points quickly become heated clashes between teams as they're contested, the ebb and flow of the match varying as units are shot down or respawn to rejoin the fray. A well-balanced match can easily run into overtime as both teams struggle for a foothold above the other. The connections were stable, however we did experience a drop from the network during one particularly heated match. With Gundam Evolution still being tested and refined, we can hope that this problem will be smoothed over.    Gundam Evolution is free-to-play and features an in-game cash shop, as well as a battle pass, alternate skins, and player icons. Old Gundams can be customized with snazzy recolors, while players can set their profile pictures to images of beloved Gundam characters like Amuro Ray or Char Aznable. Skins can also be earned by leveling up with your battle pass; the network test featured an exclusive skin for the RX-78 attainable upon reaching level 20. For the most part, skins seem to be available through a lootbox system, which players buy into via tickets earned from the cash shop or from in-game awards.     In all, Gundam Evolution's network test was a success. While some network issues interrupted the fun and the looming threat of a lootbox system shadows the game, the moment-to-moment gameplay is fun and frantic and the sheer fanservice of zipping through the map as the White Devil, complete with classic Gundam sound effects, is undeniably charming. While a definite release date has yet to be set, players can look forward to Gundam Evolution's release later this year on PS4, Xbox One, PS5, Xbox Series S and X, and Steam.     discuss this in the forum (5 posts) |        bookmark/share with:               Feature homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            interview                I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato   Apr 18, 21:00                 live-action    This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. PREVIEW: The Mecha Action-Shooter Gundam Evolution   by Jean-Karlo Lemus, Apr 14th 2022          The Gundam universe has no shortage of video game adaptations, and this past week saw the five-day-long network test for Bandai Namco's newest take on the storied franchise. Gundam Evolution stands poised to be the franchise's first-ever free-to-play shooter. We were allowed to take part in the network test for the Steam version of the game and experience it first-hand.     As the title implies, players operate as specific mobile suits from across the Gundam franchise. The selection of mech units is surprisingly eclectic: while the traditional RX-78-2 Mobile Suit is of course selectable, armed with its beam cannon and hammer, players can also control the Turn ∀  Gundam, the Gundam Exia, the Barbatos Gundam, and even non-Gundam units like the Guntank, the Zaku II, and the Dom. Each unit controls more or less the same, with the main differences being the nature of their weapons and their skills: while most units like the RX-78 focus on ranged weapons, some units like the Barbatos or the Exia focus on melee attacks. Being mechs, each unit has thrusters that allow for dashes, boosts, and hovering, adding lots of complexity to movement. Each unit also features two unique skills with cooldowns, and a chargeable G-maneuver that unleashes a special skill. During our playtime, we specialized in the Turn ∀ Gundam, which featured a charge shot for their beam canon, a personal healing skill, and a grappling attack. In all, there are 14 playable units.    Gundam Evolution's network test consisted of simple online ranked matches where teams of six compete against each other. Three gameplay modes will be featured in the full game: Point Capture, Domination, and Destruction. Each mode features teams alternating between Attackers and Defenders, tasked with either carrying out specific objectives or preventing the opposing team from carrying them out. Domination requires Attackers to capture one of three randomly-spawning objectives, Destruction requires charging a bomb at a point on the map until it detonates the point, and Point Capture involves simply occupying a point on the map in order to score points. During our time in the Network Test, we only experienced Point Capture. We also only tested out one map, but there was no shortage of excitement to be had. Further gameplay modes have been promised in the future following the full release of the title.     Matches are a good mix of hectic chaos and tense anticipation. A lack of awareness will get you destroyed in short order, thus a keen eye and quick reflexes are essential to survival. It's possible to rescue downed units before they're destroyed, albeit at the risk of leaving yourself open to attackers that are no doubt still in the area. Capture points quickly become heated clashes between teams as they're contested, the ebb and flow of the match varying as units are shot down or respawn to rejoin the fray. A well-balanced match can easily run into overtime as both teams struggle for a foothold above the other. The connections were stable, however we did experience a drop from the network during one particularly heated match. With Gundam Evolution still being tested and refined, we can hope that this problem will be smoothed over.    Gundam Evolution is free-to-play and features an in-game cash shop, as well as a battle pass, alternate skins, and player icons. Old Gundams can be customized with snazzy recolors, while players can set their profile pictures to images of beloved Gundam characters like Amuro Ray or Char Aznable. Skins can also be earned by leveling up with your battle pass; the network test featured an exclusive skin for the RX-78 attainable upon reaching level 20. For the most part, skins seem to be available through a lootbox system, which players buy into via tickets earned from the cash shop or from in-game awards.     In all, Gundam Evolution's network test was a success. While some network issues interrupted the fun and the looming threat of a lootbox system shadows the game, the moment-to-moment gameplay is fun and frantic and the sheer fanservice of zipping through the map as the White Devil, complete with classic Gundam sound effects, is undeniably charming. While a definite release date has yet to be set, players can look forward to Gundam Evolution's release later this year on PS4, Xbox One, PS5, Xbox Series S and X, and Steam.     discuss this in the forum (5 posts) |        bookmark/share with:               Feature homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            interview                I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato   Apr 18, 21:00                 live-action    This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. Title: PREVIEW: The Mecha Action-Shooter Gundam Evolution - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.                PREVIEW: The Mecha Action-Shooter Gundam Evolution   by Jean-Karlo Lemus, Apr 14th 2022          The Gundam universe has no shortage of video game adaptations, and this past week saw the five-day-long network test for Bandai Namco's newest take on the storied franchise. Gundam Evolution stands poised to be the franchise's first-ever free-to-play shooter. We were allowed to take part in the network test for the Steam version of the game and experience it first-hand.     As the title implies, players operate as specific mobile suits from across the Gundam franchise. The selection of mech units is surprisingly eclectic: while the traditional RX-78-2 Mobile Suit is of course selectable, armed with its beam cannon and hammer, players can also control the Turn ∀  Gundam, the Gundam Exia, the Barbatos Gundam, and even non-Gundam units like the Guntank, the Zaku II, and the Dom. Each unit controls more or less the same, with the main differences being the nature of their weapons and their skills: while most units like the RX-78 focus on ranged weapons, some units like the Barbatos or the Exia focus on melee attacks. Being mechs, each unit has thrusters that allow for dashes, boosts, and hovering, adding lots of complexity to movement. Each unit also features two unique skills with cooldowns, and a chargeable G-maneuver that unleashes a special skill. During our playtime, we specialized in the Turn ∀ Gundam, which featured a charge shot for their beam canon, a personal healing skill, and a grappling attack. In all, there are 14 playable units.    Gundam Evolution's network test consisted of simple online ranked matches where teams of six compete against each other. Three gameplay modes will be featured in the full game: Point Capture, Domination, and Destruction. Each mode features teams alternating between Attackers and Defenders, tasked with either carrying out specific objectives or preventing the opposing team from carrying them out. Domination requires Attackers to capture one of three randomly-spawning objectives, Destruction requires charging a bomb at a point on the map until it detonates the point, and Point Capture involves simply occupying a point on the map in order to score points. During our time in the Network Test, we only experienced Point Capture. We also only tested out one map, but there was no shortage of excitement to be had. Further gameplay modes have been promised in the future following the full release of the title.     Matches are a good mix of hectic chaos and tense anticipation. A lack of awareness will get you destroyed in short order, thus a keen eye and quick reflexes are essential to survival. It's possible to rescue downed units before they're destroyed, albeit at the risk of leaving yourself open to attackers that are no doubt still in the area. Capture points quickly become heated clashes between teams as they're contested, the ebb and flow of the match varying as units are shot down or respawn to rejoin the fray. A well-balanced match can easily run into overtime as both teams struggle for a foothold above the other. The connections were stable, however we did experience a drop from the network during one particularly heated match. With Gundam Evolution still being tested and refined, we can hope that this problem will be smoothed over.    Gundam Evolution is free-to-play and features an in-game cash shop, as well as a battle pass, alternate skins, and player icons. Old Gundams can be customized with snazzy recolors, while players can set their profile pictures to images of beloved Gundam characters like Amuro Ray or Char Aznable. Skins can also be earned by leveling up with your battle pass; the network test featured an exclusive skin for the RX-78 attainable upon reaching level 20. For the most part, skins seem to be available through a lootbox system, which players buy into via tickets earned from the cash shop or from in-game awards.     In all, Gundam Evolution's network test was a success. While some network issues interrupted the fun and the looming threat of a lootbox system shadows the game, the moment-to-moment gameplay is fun and frantic and the sheer fanservice of zipping through the map as the White Devil, complete with classic Gundam sound effects, is undeniably charming. While a definite release date has yet to be set, players can look forward to Gundam Evolution's release later this year on PS4, Xbox One, PS5, Xbox Series S and X, and Steam.     discuss this in the forum (5 posts) |        bookmark/share with:               Feature homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            interview                I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato   Apr 18, 21:00                 live-action    This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. Data: review                Futsal Boys!!!!! Streaming   Apr 15, 00:00                 anime    While Futsal Boys!!!!! isn't alone in its enthusiasm for its own title, it also isn't up to the task of living up to it, either in terms of sports-related lunacy or its love of its subject matter. ― In the novel Reaper Man, the late, great Terry Pratchett remarked that “Five exclamation marks [are] the sure sign of an insane mind.” While Futsal Boys!!!!! isn't alone in its enthusiasm for its own titl...

(movie) 9.01 1196   5 Rurouni Kenshin: Trust & Betrayal (OAV) 8.96 6685   6 Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion R2 (TV) 8.93 7914   7 Spirited Away (movie) 8.92 10607   8 Cowboy Bebop (TV) 8.89 12345   9 Mushishi: The Next Chapter (TV) 8.88 543   10 Princess Mononoke (movie) 8.86 9891  This rating only includes titles that have at least 12 votes. The bayesian estimate is a statistical technique used to reduce the noise due to low sample counts. In effect, the less a title has votes, the more it is pulled towards the mean (7.492). In other words, these are the titles that many people agree are great.  (formula)  bayesian rating = (v ÷ (v+m)) × R + (m ÷ (v+m)) × C  where:   R = average for the anime   v = number of votes for the anime   m = minimum votes required to be listed (currently 12)   C = the mean vote across the whole report (currently 7.492)    Top 10 Worst Rated (bayesian estimate) (Top 50)  # title rating nb. votes   6730 Hametsu No Mars (OAV) 1.94 213   6729 Skelter+Heaven (OAV) 2.38 76   6728 SD Gundam Force (TV) 2.86 502   6727 Psychic Wars (OAV) 2.97 133   6726 MD Geist II - Death Force (OAV) 3.36 292   6725 Utsu-musume Sayuri (movie) 3.44 25   6724 EX-ARM (TV) 3.45 31   6723 Tekken: The Motion Picture (OAV) 3.46 721   6722 Duel Masters (TV) 3.46 626   6721 D.I.C.E. (TV) 3.55 154  This rating only includes titles that have at least 12 votes. The bayesian estimate is a statistical technique used to reduce the noise due to low sample counts. In effect, the less a title has votes, the more it is pulled towards the mean (7.492). In other words, these are the titles that many people agree are awful.  (formula)  bayesian rating = (v ÷ (v+m)) × R + (m ÷ (v+m)) × C  where:   R = average for the anime   v = number of votes for the anime   m = minimum votes required to be listed (currently 12)   C = the mean vote across the whole report (currently 7.492)    Top 10 Best Rated (weighted average) (Top 50)  # title rating nb. votes   30 Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood (TV) 9.09 5962   31 Steins;Gate (TV) 9.04 4771   32 Clannad After Story (TV) 9.02 5308   34 your name. Titles with less than 4 votes are removed from the list but are still counted in the ranking. This explains why there may be gaps in the "#" column.    Top 10 Most Popular (Top 50)  # title rating nb. votes   1 Fullmetal Alchemist (TV) 8.73 13472   2 Death Note (TV) 8.86 12994   3 Cowboy Bebop (TV) 8.93 12345   4 Spirited Away (movie) 8.97 10607   5 Princess Mononoke (movie) 8.93 9891   6 (The) Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya (TV) 8.56 10194   7 Elfen Lied (TV) 8.30 10501   8 Neon Genesis Evangelion (TV) 8.32 10298   9 Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion (TV) 8.85 9235   10 Bleach (TV) 7.95 9199  The most popular titles are determined with a simple summation of all votes. Titles with many votes will tend to be at the top, but this is modified a little by the ratings. In other words, the popularity is the straight average score of a title (the value in the rating column) multiplied by the number of votes. The bayesian estimate is a statistical technique used to reduce the noise due to low sample counts. In effect, the less a title has votes, the more it is pulled towards the mean (7.492). (movie) 9.01 1196   5 Rurouni Kenshin: Trust & Betrayal (OAV) 8.96 6685   6 Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion R2 (TV) 8.93 7914   7 Spirited Away (movie) 8.92 10607   8 Cowboy Bebop (TV) 8.89 12345   9 Mushishi: The Next Chapter (TV) 8.88 543   10 Princess Mononoke (movie) 8.86 9891  This rating only includes titles that have at least 12 votes. The bayesian estimate is a statistical technique used to reduce the noise due to low sample counts. In effect, the less a title has votes, the more it is pulled towards the mean (7.492). In other words, these are the titles that many people agree are great.  (formula)  bayesian rating = (v ÷ (v+m)) × R + (m ÷ (v+m)) × C  where:   R = average for the anime   v = number of votes for the anime   m = minimum votes required to be listed (currently 12)   C = the mean vote across the whole report (currently 7.492)    Top 10 Worst Rated (bayesian estimate) (Top 50)  # title rating nb. votes   6730 Hametsu No Mars (OAV) 1.94 213   6729 Skelter+Heaven (OAV) 2.38 76   6728 SD Gundam Force (TV) 2.86 502   6727 Psychic Wars (OAV) 2.97 133   6726 MD Geist II - Death Force (OAV) 3.36 292   6725 Utsu-musume Sayuri (movie) 3.44 25   6724 EX-ARM (TV) 3.45 31   6723 Tekken: The Motion Picture (OAV) 3.46 721   6722 Duel Masters (TV) 3.46 626   6721 D.I.C.E. Streaming   Apr 15, 00:00                 anime    While Futsal Boys!!!!! isn't alone in its enthusiasm for its own title, it also isn't up to the task of living up to it, either in terms of sports-related lunacy or its love of its subject matter. ― In the novel Reaper Man, the late, great Terry Pratchett remarked that “Five exclamation marks [are] the sure sign of an insane mind.” While Futsal Boys!!!!! isn't alone in its enthusiasm for its own titl...

Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             CONNECTHome            Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives                   All material Copyright © 1998-2022 Anime News Network. Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             CONNECTHome            Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives                   All material Copyright © 1998-2022 Anime News Network. Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives                   All material Copyright © 1998-2022 Anime News Network. Title: Home - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             CONNECTHome            Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives

Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives

LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.

News Alice Gear Aegis CS Game Releases for PS4, PS5, Switch on September 8   posted on 2022-04-16 13:16 UTC-8 by Crystalyn Hodgkins         Console version of smartphone game to have 6-person multiplayer, 3D action elements    MAGES. announced on Saturday that it will release Alice Gear Aegis CS: Concerto of Simulatrix, a console version of Pyramid and COLOPL's Alice Gear Aegis smartphone game, on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and Nintendo Switch on September 8. The console version of the game will include six-person multiplayer, 3D action elements, and various gameplay modes. Humikane Shimada is again in charge of character designs, and sound creator group ZUNTATA is composing the music.      The original Alice Gear Aegis smartphone game launched for iOS and Android devices in January 2018.    The 3D mecha shooting game features character supervision and designs by Humikane Shimada (Frame Arms Girl, Girls und Panzer, Strike Witches). In the game's story, girls called Actresses battle mysterious machine lifeforms known as Vices.    The Alice Gear Aegis: Doki! Actress Darake no Mermaid Grand Prix (Throb! The Mermaid Grand Prix Full of Actresses) OVA launched on September 15.    The game is also inspiring a television anime adaptation.    Sources: Alice Gear Aegis CS: Concerto of Simulatrix game's website, 4Gamer (maru) via Hachima Kikō        discuss this in the forum |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            interview                I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato   Apr 18, 21:00                 live-action    This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. News Alice Gear Aegis CS Game Releases for PS4, PS5, Switch on September 8   posted on 2022-04-16 13:16 UTC-8 by Crystalyn Hodgkins         Console version of smartphone game to have 6-person multiplayer, 3D action elements    MAGES. announced on Saturday that it will release Alice Gear Aegis CS: Concerto of Simulatrix, a console version of Pyramid and COLOPL's Alice Gear Aegis smartphone game, on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and Nintendo Switch on September 8. The console version of the game will include six-person multiplayer, 3D action elements, and various gameplay modes. Humikane Shimada is again in charge of character designs, and sound creator group ZUNTATA is composing the music.      The original Alice Gear Aegis smartphone game launched for iOS and Android devices in January 2018.    The 3D mecha shooting game features character supervision and designs by Humikane Shimada (Frame Arms Girl, Girls und Panzer, Strike Witches). In the game's story, girls called Actresses battle mysterious machine lifeforms known as Vices.    The Alice Gear Aegis: Doki! Actress Darake no Mermaid Grand Prix (Throb! The Mermaid Grand Prix Full of Actresses) OVA launched on September 15.    The game is also inspiring a television anime adaptation.    Sources: Alice Gear Aegis CS: Concerto of Simulatrix game's website, 4Gamer (maru) via Hachima Kikō        discuss this in the forum |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            interview                I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato   Apr 18, 21:00                 live-action    This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. News Alice Gear Aegis CS Game Releases for PS4, PS5, Switch on September 8   posted on 2022-04-16 13:16 UTC-8 by Crystalyn Hodgkins         Console version of smartphone game to have 6-person multiplayer, 3D action elements    MAGES. announced on Saturday that it will release Alice Gear Aegis CS: Concerto of Simulatrix, a console version of Pyramid and COLOPL's Alice Gear Aegis smartphone game, on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and Nintendo Switch on September 8. The console version of the game will include six-person multiplayer, 3D action elements, and various gameplay modes. Humikane Shimada is again in charge of character designs, and sound creator group ZUNTATA is composing the music.      The original Alice Gear Aegis smartphone game launched for iOS and Android devices in January 2018.    The 3D mecha shooting game features character supervision and designs by Humikane Shimada (Frame Arms Girl, Girls und Panzer, Strike Witches). In the game's story, girls called Actresses battle mysterious machine lifeforms known as Vices.    The Alice Gear Aegis: Doki! Actress Darake no Mermaid Grand Prix (Throb! The Mermaid Grand Prix Full of Actresses) OVA launched on September 15.    The game is also inspiring a television anime adaptation. News Angela Vocalist Cancels Appearance Due to Suspected Case of COVID-19, 2 hololive VTubers Test Positive for COVID-19   posted on 2022-04-17 04:30 UTC-8 by Crystalyn Hodgkins         Houshou Marine, Ookami Mio tested positive for COVID-19 in last week    The official website for the musical duo angela announced on Friday that vocalist Atsuko canceled a guest performance on Sayaka Sasaki's "SAYAKAVER. LIVE triangle" concert on Sunday due to Atsuko having a "suspected" case of COVID-19. The website did not confirm if Atsuko had taken a COVID-19 test.    The angela duo includes keyboardist and guitarist Katsu and vocalist Atsuko. The group debuted in 1999 with the single "memories," which was used as the opening theme song for the Shin Hakkenden anime. The duo became more well known after the 2003 single "Asu e no brilliant road," which was used as the opening theme song for Stellvia, for which angela also performed three ending themes. The group has performed theme songs for such anime as Corpse Princess, Asura Cryin', Fafner EXODUS, K: Return of Kings, Ajin, Blame!, My Next Life as a Villainess: All Routes Lead to Doom!, and Aho Girl, among many others.    Relatedly, Hololive Production announced recently that two of its VTubers have tested positive for COVID-19. The company stated on April 11 that its VTuber Houshou Marine tested positive on the same day, and that all of the company staff and talents she was in close contact with tested negative. Houshou Marine stated on Twitter on Friday that while she still has a cough and it is difficult to talk, that her body is healthy again.    Hololive Production also announced on Friday that its VTuber Ookami Mio tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. Hololive stated currently she is recovering per the guidance of health care personnel, and none of its other talents were considered close contacts. Ookami Mio stated on Saturday that her fever has now subsided and is at a normal temperature.    The first generation of hololive performers debuted in 2018. Over 50 Virtual YouTubers currently belong to hololive. The talents perform using intricate 2D and 3D avatars provided by the company. Cover Corporation launched hololive Indonesia — a spinoff group aimed towards the Indonesian audience — in April 2020, followed by hololive English in September 2020. The all-male holostars spinoff group debuted its first generation talent in June 2019. According to Hololive Production's English website, it has around 50 million fans across all its channels.    Sources: angela's website, Mio Ookami's Twitter account, Marine Houshou's Twitter account, Hololive Production's Twitter account, Cover Corporation's Twitter account via Hachima Kikō, Yaraon!        discuss this in the forum (2 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            interview                I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato   Apr 18, 21:00                 live-action    This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. News Angela Vocalist Cancels Appearance Due to Suspected Case of COVID-19, 2 hololive VTubers Test Positive for COVID-19   posted on 2022-04-17 04:30 UTC-8 by Crystalyn Hodgkins         Houshou Marine, Ookami Mio tested positive for COVID-19 in last week    The official website for the musical duo angela announced on Friday that vocalist Atsuko canceled a guest performance on Sayaka Sasaki's "SAYAKAVER. LIVE triangle" concert on Sunday due to Atsuko having a "suspected" case of COVID-19. The website did not confirm if Atsuko had taken a COVID-19 test.    The angela duo includes keyboardist and guitarist Katsu and vocalist Atsuko. The group debuted in 1999 with the single "memories," which was used as the opening theme song for the Shin Hakkenden anime. The duo became more well known after the 2003 single "Asu e no brilliant road," which was used as the opening theme song for Stellvia, for which angela also performed three ending themes. The group has performed theme songs for such anime as Corpse Princess, Asura Cryin', Fafner EXODUS, K: Return of Kings, Ajin, Blame!, My Next Life as a Villainess: All Routes Lead to Doom!, and Aho Girl, among many others.    Relatedly, Hololive Production announced recently that two of its VTubers have tested positive for COVID-19. The company stated on April 11 that its VTuber Houshou Marine tested positive on the same day, and that all of the company staff and talents she was in close contact with tested negative. Houshou Marine stated on Twitter on Friday that while she still has a cough and it is difficult to talk, that her body is healthy again.    Hololive Production also announced on Friday that its VTuber Ookami Mio tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. Hololive stated currently she is recovering per the guidance of health care personnel, and none of its other talents were considered close contacts. Ookami Mio stated on Saturday that her fever has now subsided and is at a normal temperature.    The first generation of hololive performers debuted in 2018. Over 50 Virtual YouTubers currently belong to hololive. The talents perform using intricate 2D and 3D avatars provided by the company. Cover Corporation launched hololive Indonesia — a spinoff group aimed towards the Indonesian audience — in April 2020, followed by hololive English in September 2020. The all-male holostars spinoff group debuted its first generation talent in June 2019. According to Hololive Production's English website, it has around 50 million fans across all its channels.    Sources: angela's website, Mio Ookami's Twitter account, Marine Houshou's Twitter account, Hololive Production's Twitter account, Cover Corporation's Twitter account via Hachima Kikō, Yaraon!        discuss this in the forum (2 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            interview                I Want to Hold Aono-kun So Badly I Could Die Live-Action Star Shori Sato   Apr 18, 21:00                 live-action    This isn't Shori Sato's first role in a live-action adaptation of a pop culture work, but his role as the eponymous Aono-kun is something a little different– he's a ghost. Title: Angela Vocalist Cancels Appearance Due to Suspected Case of COVID-19, 2 hololive VTubers Test Positive for COVID-19 - News - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             News Angela Vocalist Cancels Appearance Due to Suspected Case of COVID-19, 2 hololive VTubers Test Positive for COVID-19   posted on 2022-04-17 04:30 UTC-8 by Crystalyn Hodgkins         Houshou Marine, Ookami Mio tested positive for COVID-19 in last week    The official website for the musical duo angela announced on Friday that vocalist Atsuko canceled a guest performance on Sayaka Sasaki's "SAYAKAVER. LIVE triangle" concert on Sunday due to Atsuko having a "suspected" case of COVID-19. The website did not confirm if Atsuko had taken a COVID-19 test.    The angela duo includes keyboardist and guitarist Katsu and vocalist Atsuko. The group debuted in 1999 with the single "memories," which was used as the opening theme song for the Shin Hakkenden anime. The duo became more well known after the 2003 single "Asu e no brilliant road," which was used as the opening theme song for Stellvia, for which angela also performed three ending themes. The group has performed theme songs for such anime as Corpse Princess, Asura Cryin', Fafner EXODUS, K: Return of Kings, Ajin, Blame!, My Next Life as a Villainess: All Routes Lead to Doom!, and Aho Girl, among many others.    Relatedly, Hololive Production announced recently that two of its VTubers have tested positive for COVID-19. The company stated on April 11 that its VTuber Houshou Marine tested positive on the same day, and that all of the company staff and talents she was in close contact with tested negative. Houshou Marine stated on Twitter on Friday that while she still has a cough and it is difficult to talk, that her body is healthy again.    Hololive Production also announced on Friday that its VTuber Ookami Mio tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. Hololive stated currently she is recovering per the guidance of health care personnel, and none of its other talents were considered close contacts. Ookami Mio stated on Saturday that her fever has now subsided and is at a normal temperature.    The first generation of hololive performers debuted in 2018. Over 50 Virtual YouTubers currently belong to hololive. The talents perform using intricate 2D and 3D avatars provided by the company. Cover Corporation launched hololive Indonesia — a spinoff group aimed towards the Indonesian audience — in April 2020, followed by hololive English in September 2020. The all-male holostars spinoff group debuted its first generation talent in June 2019. According to Hololive Production's English website, it has around 50 million fans across all its channels.    Sources: angela's website, Mio Ookami's Twitter account, Marine Houshou's Twitter account, Hololive Production's Twitter account, Cover Corporation's Twitter account via Hachima Kikō, Yaraon!        discuss this in the forum (2 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More
